column2: VERMONT PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Vermont
column6: VT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. BAC is expressed in:
column4: percentage of blood to alcohol.
column6: AAI (Acute Alcohol Intoxication) level.
column10: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 2. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column10: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.

column2: 3. A driver approaching a flashing red traffic signal must:
column4: stop before the intersection.
column6: carefully drive through the intersection without stopping.
column8: slow down at the traffic signal.
column10: merge to the left.

column2: 4. To enter a freeway:
column4: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column6: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column8: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.
column10: drive slowly so you can check traffic.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Low ground railroad crossing
column6: No-passing zone
column10: Pedestrian crossing

column2: 6. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column6: maintain a constant speed.
column8: drive faster than the flow of traffic.
column10: drive with the flow of traffic.

column2: 7. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column10: must make a U-turn and then turn right.

column2: 8. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when following motorcycles.
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column8: when it is hard to see ahead.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 9. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: right turns are not allowed.
column6: there is an intersection ahead.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 10. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: Driving within the range.
column6: The use of headlight is required by law.
column10: Reduced speed.

column2: 11. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column10: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 12. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: towards the right side of the road.
column6: None of the other answers is correct.
column8: towards the left side of the road.
column10: straight down the middle of the road.

column2: 13. This sign means:
column4: series of curves ahead.
column6: narrow road ahead.
column8: the road may be slippery when wet.
column10: no turns are allowed on this road.

column2: 14. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: increase your speed and move to the left.
column6: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column10: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.

column2: 15. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column6: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.
column10: Drivers who have overslept.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: School zone ahead
column6: Sharp turn, slow down
column10: Construction zone ahead

column2: 17. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: that there's a school zone ahead.
column6: the direction they should travel.
column10: what is not allowed.

column2: 18. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
column4: solid yellow
column6: broken white
column10: double solid yellow

column2: 19. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column6: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column8: Only if the light is green.
column10: Yes.

column2: 20. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: look for a detour or another route.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column10: remove the sign and move forward.
